intro: Verbesina tapantiana, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a rough texture, while its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters. Verbesina tapantiana is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in poor soil conditions.
